descriptions.description: The Total Carbon Column Observing Network (TCCON) is a network of ground-based Fourier Transform Spectrometers that record direct solar absorption spectra of the atmosphere in the near-infrared. From these spectra, accurate and precise column-averaged abundances of atmospheric constituents including CO2, CH4, N2O, HF, CO, H2O, and HDO, are retrieved. This data set contains observations from the TCCON station at Hefei (PRC).

Cite this record as:
Liu, C., Wang, W., Sun, Y., & , (2018). TCCON data from Hefei (PRC), Release GGG2014.R0 [Data set]. CaltechDATA. https://doi.org/10.14291/tccon.ggg2014.hefei01.r0
